intro: Gnidia obtusissima, commonly known as the broad-leaved gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a round, fleshy berry that turns red when mature. Gnidia obtusissima is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
